definition: to blink/to wink/in the twinkling of an eye
to murder without blinking an eye (idiom)/ruthless/cold-blooded

sentences.english: So they winked and they blinked in the sand in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 於是，它們在陽光下的沙地上眨着眼睛。

sentences.english: No sooner was Bahlul seated than he winked at the prince .
sentences.chinese: 巴魯剛一坐下就對王子眨一下眼睛。

sentences.english: I passed from her eyes, she has been aware of it, but the eye-blink.
sentences.chinese: 我從她眼前走過，她有所覺察，眼睛卻一眨不眨。

sentences.english: The Brute looked about the bridge, blinked, and then glared at Fred.
sentences.chinese: 鬼面獸看着艦橋，眨着眼睛，然後怒視着弗雷德。
“它，它沒燃燒，”達多眨了眨眼睛。

sentences.english: The little girl winked away her tears.
Polly's eyelids flickered, then she slept.
sentences.chinese: 珀利的眼皮眨了眨，然後睡着了。

sentences.english: Polly's eyelids flickered, then she slept.
sentences.chinese: 珀利的眼皮眨了眨，然後睡着了。

sentences.english: The doctor saw my anxiety and chuckled, then winked at me cheekily .
sentences.chinese: 他看到我的焦慮然後喫喫地笑，偷樂地向我眨着眼睛。

sentences.english: The boy blinked up at me in some surprise.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩有些喫驚地眨着眼看我。

sentences.english: Trevor rolled his eyes as he and Lionel strolled behind the girls.
sentences.chinese: 特雷福眨了眨言，和萊昂內爾跟在女生後面。

sentences.english: Trevor rolled his eyes as he and Lionel strolled behind the girls.
sentences.chinese: 特雷福眨了眨言，和萊昂內爾跟在女生後面。

sentences.english: Aziraphale blinked, lowered his hands, and gingerly opened the door.
sentences.chinese: 亞茨拉斐爾眨眨眼，放下手，小心翼翼的打開車門。

sentences.english: He just stood there, staring at me blankly. He blinked again.
sentences.chinese: 他只是站在那裏茫然的看着我，再次眨了眨眼。

sentences.english: And then, God help me, I wink.
sentences.chinese: 接着，鬼使神差，我眨了一下眼。
他眨眨眼，傳來男人的信號，默許了吉姆的罪過。

definition: to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
to blink/to wink/in the twinkling of an eye
to narrow one's eyes/to squint/(dialect) to take a nap
eyeball/fig. the apple of one's eye (i.e. favorite person)
